metadata.synopsis: Memnos, a tiefling, is praying/hiding while the goblins attack the Druid Grove. He admits that he's lost his nerve and doesn't want to fight off the attackers. We can try to persuade him and give him courage; if we succeed, he'll join the defences. Fail, and he'll continue cowering.

3.speaker: Memnos
3.text: You'd do better to find somewhere safe than wasting your time on me.

13.speaker: Memnos
13.text: 'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'
13.context: NodeContext: Praying to himself. Interrupted by the player

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *You recognise Kelemvor, the Lord of Death. The tiefling thinks he will die soon.*

14.speaker: Memnos
14.text: You've solved one problem for us. Guess it's on us to solve the next.

15.speaker: Memnos
15.text: 'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'

72.speaker: Player
72.text: *You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*

44.text: *You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*

60.speaker: Memnos
60.text: What is it? I'm... I'm busy.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Mind if I join you in prayer?

0.speaker: Memnos
0.text: I do mind. This isn't exactly my bravest moment; I'd rather suffer it alone.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I knew I smelled the stink of cowardice.
71.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: I knew I smelled the stink of cowardice.
47.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Kelemvor judges cowards more harshly than others. Better if you die in combat.
21.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Kelemvor judges cowards more harshly than others. Better if you die in combat.
11.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Better if you die in combat then live on as a coward.
51.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

65.speaker: Memnos
65.text: Mrag. Of course I'm going to die... but I might as well get my hands dirty before that.
65.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

22.speaker: Memnos
22.text: Mrag. Of course I'm going to die... but I might as well get my hands dirty before that.
22.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

33.speaker: Memnos
33.context: NodeContext: A little more resolve than before

74.text: Oh, I'll die today. That much I'm sure of. But I'll do it here, on my own terms. Leave me.

6.speaker: Memnos
6.text: Oh, I'll die today. That much I'm sure of. But I'll do it here, on my own terms. Leave me.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'll kill you myself if you don't grab a weapon and join the line.
56.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

46.speaker: Memnos
46.text: Mrag. Who needs goblins to be afraid of when we've you for company?
46.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

45.speaker: Memnos
45.text: Mrag. Who needs goblins to be afraid of when we've you for company?
45.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

30.speaker: Memnos
30.text: Fine. I'll see what I can do. It won't be much - trust me.
30.context: NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

34.text: There's a horde coming for us all. Do you really think I care about your threats?
34.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

53.speaker: Memnos
53.text: There's a horde coming for us all. Do you really think I care about your threats?
53.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

25.speaker: Memnos
25.text: Leave me spend my final moments how I want.
25.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

36.speaker: Memnos
36.text: Crazy fool! Are you in a rush to see us all dead?!

24.speaker: Player
24.context: NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You have to try. We need every able body, or we're doomed.
7.context: NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

19.speaker: Memnos
19.text: Damn you... fine. I'll see what I can do. Maybe I'll manage to take a goblin down with me.
19.context: NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

10.speaker: Memnos
10.text: Damn you... fine. I'll see what I can do. Maybe I'll manage to take a goblin down with me.
10.context: NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

35.text: We're doomed either way. Best to stop struggling and hope the end's swift.

27.speaker: Memnos
27.text: We're doomed either way. Best to stop struggling and hope the end's swift.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Songs will be sung for today's heroes. Do your part, and your name will live on.
52.context: NodeContext: Reluctantly getting over his fears and agreeing to fight.

50.speaker: Memnos
50.text: Mrag. I'd like to see 'Memnos' rhyme in some heroic verse. Fine. I'll help.

2.speaker: Memnos
2.text: Mrag. I'd like to see 'Memnos' rhyme in some heroic verse. Fine. I'll help.

1.text: I don't care about my blasted name. The dead don't need compliments from the living. Leave me alone.

73.speaker: Memnos
73.text: I don't care about my blasted name. The dead don't need compliments from the living. Leave me alone.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Every fighter was once a novice. Better that than a victim.
57.context: NodeContext: Reluctantly getting over his fears and agreeing to fight.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: My god abhors cowards. If you do nothing, your fate is sealed in his eyes.
75.context: NodeContext: Reluctantly getting over his fears and agreeing to fight.

9.speaker: Memnos
9.text: Damned either way then... but at least I can go out with a weapon in my hand. All right. I'll do what I can.
9.context: NodeContext: Reluctantly getting over his fears and agreeing to fight.

26.speaker: Memnos
26.text: Why, because I'm not sharpening steel or strutting on the wall?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Prayers can wait - you're needed to help with the defences.

63.speaker: Memnos
63.text: I can pray a lot better than I can use a bow or a sword.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Why are you praying to the god of the dead?

23.speaker: Memnos
23.text: Well, seems like I'll be facing him before long. All of us will.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Kelemvor's judgement is always fair. You're wasting your time trying to curry his favour.

66.speaker: Memnos
66.text: Prayer's all I've got right now. And best to pray to the god I'm liable to meet soon.

28.speaker: Memnos
28.text: This is a beautiful place - and I can't bloody wait to be free of it.

32.speaker: Memnos
32.text: I doubt I'd still be drawing breath without your help. Thank you.

38.speaker: Memnos
38.text: We won. I'd like to think Arka died happy, but... well. Perhaps now she's at peace.
38.context: NodeContext: confused that he enjoyed killing goblins so much - think of him staring at her bloody hands

39.speaker: Memnos
39.text: Spare me your empty threats and go away, mragreshem.
39.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

54.speaker: Memnos
54.text: We... we actually did it. We thrashed the lot of them!
54.context: NodeContext: confused that he enjoyed killing goblins so much - think of him staring at her bloody hands

62.speaker: Memnos
62.text: Thank you, for talking some sense into me. I'll do my best when the fighting starts.
62.context: NodeContext: trying to stay calm, but scared

69.speaker: Memnos
69.text: 'Kelemvor to judge kindly, Helm to protect -'
69.context: NodeContext: Praying to himself. Interrupted by the player

78.speaker: Memnos
78.text: Please, leave me be. I said I was busy.

76.speaker: Memnos
76.text: Can't you just leave me be? This is my last moment of peace.
76.context: NodeContext: Just wants to curl up and hide

77.speaker: Memnos
77.text: Don't... don't say any words over her. Arka wouldn't want that.
